div.l: Þese clerkes beten hym well ⁊and lat hym lyeA 4308
And greythen hem ⁊and toke her hors anon̄
And eke her mele ⁊and on her wey þey gon̄
And at þᵉ mylle dore þei toke þ̉er cake
of half a busshell floure wel ybake
Þus is þᵉ proud myller wel ybete
And hath lost þᵉ gryndyng of þᵉ whete
And payed for the soꝑper euery dele4315
Of Aleyn ⁊and of Iohn þᵗat betten hym well
His wyf is swyued ⁊and douhter als
Lo such hit is a myller to be fals
And þ̉erto þis ꝓprouerbe is seyd full soþ
Hym thar not wene wel þᵗat euel doþ4320
A gyloᵘur shall hym self begyled be
And god þat sittes hye in mageste
Saue all þis company grete ⁊and smale
Þus haue I quyt þᵉ myller his tale
þᵉ cokes prologe
The Cook of london whyles þᵉ Reue spak A 4325
For Ioye hym þouht he clawed hym on þᵉ bak
A ha qduod he for cristes passioun̄
myller hath a sharp conclusioun̄
Vpon his argument of herbygage
Well seyde salomon in his langage
Bringe not eủery man vn to þyn house
For herborewynge by nytht is ꝑperelouse
Well auht a man a vised for to be
Whom þat he brouth to his pⁱriuete
I pᵃray to god ȝeue me sorowe ⁊and care 4335
